document.heading: Act to Preserve the Habitability of Rental Units Subject to Notices to Vacate

history.narrative: Law 1-129, the “Act to Preserve the Habitability of Rental Units Subject to Notices to Vacate” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-360, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Urban Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 12, 1976, and November 23, 1976, respectively. Enacted without signature by the Mayor on January 9, 1977, it was assigned Act No. 1-223 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
